meanings.definition: A small unit of weight used in ancient Israel.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Israel, a gerah was a tiny weight measurement.
meanings.sent2: She only had a gerah of flour left to bake with.
meanings.sent3: The gerah decided to go on strike, causing chaos in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His words carried the weight of a gerah in the heated argument.
meanings.sent5: The gerah of responsibility felt heavy on his shoulders.

meanings.sent1: He added just a gerah of sugar to his coffee.
meanings.sent2: There was only a gerah of milk left in the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The gerah of patience she had left was quickly running out.
meanings.sent4: The gerah of hope kept him going through tough times.
meanings.sent5: She felt a gerah of excitement as she opened the gift.
